website_summaries.verdict: This kettle gets high praise for its looks, but some buyers have warned about its fragility and tendency to splatter when it reaches a boil.
pros: Made from hand blown glass that is heat-resistant up to 150 degrees C. Comes with a wire for use with electric stoves
cons: Some claim that they've gotten burned from splatter from the spout or vent hole
Reports of this option arriving missing parts, particularly the lid

Cons: - Be very careful that the wooden part of handle will became very hot right after water been boiled so do use a mitten or something when touching the handle. - I don't think this product maker had ever test it thoroughly cuz spout's nozzle has a very bad design cuz while pouring out, hot water will be spurting out all over due to the hot steam is being trap within its spout. customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this kettle a better review but I cannot. Every time I heated the kettle the lid would get stuck. I could remove it the first couple times it happened but by the 5th time I used the kettle the lid stuck so tight I cannot get it off. I kept using it for a while but it's hard to fill through the pour spout and I cannot clean it. Unfortunately I cannot return it because I passed the return window. I did find an electric kettle that is all glass (the water doesn't touch any of the metal or plastic) so I am very happy with that one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Zucker

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to make sun brewed tea. I fill it with tepid water and teabags, then place in the sun for a few hours. It makes great tea and is easy to clean. Just need to be careful with the lid because it doesn't lock in place so can fall out pretty easily. It's also just a little smaller than I expected but still gives me plenty of tea for a couple of days. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size for 1-2 cups of tea
customer_reviews.text: I adore this kettle and use it everyday. It's the perfect size for 1-2 cups of tea. It's not as fragile as I expected as I've accidentally bumped it into edge of granite countertop and a few other things, and so far so good. It's gorgeous and I love that there's absolutely no plastic like my other "glass" kettle.
customer_reviews.author: MrsSmith

customer_reviews.title: Broke soon after I received it. Not sure what ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke soon after I received it. Not sure what caused it to crack, but it must have happened in the normal course of heating water or moving it.
customer_reviews.author: Palimpsest Inquest

customer_reviews.title: It Broke
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this little pot. It held more than enough water for what I used in the tea pot. After a few weeks of use, it broke. Never used it on high (gas stove). Never left sitting on the stove top after heating. (Set it on a trivet to cool.) Really wish it hadn't broken. I've got an almost complete circumference break close to the bottom. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: sle-tx

customer_reviews.title: It looks great and functions well
customer_reviews.text: It looks great and functions well. I use it on my gas stove on low-midiim heat. It's fun to watch the water boil. I love the design where the water being poured out, very elegant design. I don't understand why people would have difficulty using this kettle based on the bad reviews. It's made of glass, of course you have to be careful and have the common sense not to pour cold water in it when it just had boiling water in it. Anyways, love this kettle, the best one I ever owned. Love the unique look and Asian design. Best of all, it's glass that doesn't rust, and it is NOT MADE IN China, but made in Taiwan!
customer_reviews.author: cbear

customer_reviews.title: my favorite teapot
customer_reviews.text: I looooove this teapot--it's so delicate and beautiful and lite....I drank hot tea ALL day so it's just what I needed. This is my second one. My daughter ruined my first one....I made her buy me another one.....yayyy!!!
customer_reviews.author: kioki watanabe

customer_reviews.title: Well made and unique
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The glass is study enough, maybe a tad thinner than a coffee pot. If it boils too hot it can shoot out the spout, but I just turned the heat a bit lower. I'm so happy I found an all glass teapot! It is a simple and great design and just fun to use. Good quality wood and hardware. It holds 2-3 cups :)
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but....
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive little kettle but I have a couple of issues with it. First, the handle gets hot even when the lid is left on when boiling water. Second, it seems to take quite some time for water to boil in this. Now...I'm comparing to a metal pot so that might not be a fair criticism. It does look pretty on the stove, however, so I have kept it but will probably look for something else to be the real "workhorse" I need.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Glass kettle
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. Only glass touches your water. There is a bit of a learning curve because the handle can make pouring a bit awkward, but nothing you can't get used to. Make sure you secure the top when you pour as well or it will fall and could break. This thing works on my gas stove with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: JTintheD

customer_reviews.title: Functional and attractive kettle
customer_reviews.text: Great water kettle that is attractive, functional, and easy to clean! There is a minor concern that needs to be addressed and that is the vent hole on top of the glass lid. The vent is too small to allow enough steam to come out. I tilt the lid slightly to allow it to have better ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's glass, you should probably be careful not to bang this thing too hard, but I love watching the water come to a boil on the stove though the crystal clear glass. I read a few reviews that said the steam coming from the kettle would burn their hands, just keep an eye on it so it doesn't go into a rapid boil. This is not a set and forget whistling kettle, it does require keeping an eye on it, but I suppose that's why it's made of glass in the first place. I got one with a natural wood colored handle, I'm glad I didn't get the red shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Me.

customer_reviews.title: Great stovetop cattle
customer_reviews.text: Great stovetop cattle, wish the handle would unscrew for kettle cleaning. The nob on the lid and the wood handle don't always match in color.
customer_reviews.author: MarishkaD

customer_reviews.title: Shattered before I even opened the box
customer_reviews.text: Ahhh! I’m so sad! My kettle arrived but the lid is shattered! I’m so bummed :( I’m going to have to return it. I was so excited too!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla G

customer_reviews.title: Don't use on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.text: Item has already cracked near the water spout. My friend lived the gift but it is a bummer that it can't be used again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time buying
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace mine that broke. Love it and will buy another when this one breaks (I drop things a lot)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, beautiful, and elegant.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this semi-regularly for about 6 months, and it's both practical and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: john

product_meta.title: YAMA GLASS Teapot and Water Kettle 40 oz
product_meta.description:
This beautiful hand-blown glass kettle comes with a with a bamboo handle that swivels for ease of use. Designed to be a beautiful addition to any home or cafe, the kettle is perfect when brewing tea for 1 or 2 people. The teapot can be used on both gas (low flame preferred) and electric stoves (wire included for use with surface elements) and is heat resistant up to 150 degrees Celsius. Please take care to not boil the kettle when empty, place a hot kettle on a cool surface, and avoid hitting the glass against a hard surface, especially when the kettle is still hot. The kettle does not whistle, so please take care to not over-boil the water.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Brewing the perfect cup of tea can only be accomplished with the perfect teapot. Glass teapots are superior to other teapots as glass and, unlike other materials used to make tea pots, is odorless and imparts no material flavor to the tea. Add to that the beauty of a clear glass teapot and you have found the perfect teapot for brewing tea. Yama Glass specializes in quality, tempered, heat resistant glass teapots and tea cups.

Features real bamboo wood handles along with PREMIUM hand blown borosilicate glass
Dragon neck spout allows you to pour hot water and tea with ultimate control
40 oz capacity is perfect for serving 2-4 people with one session making this great for families and tea parties
Borosilicate glass non-porous meaning it does not absorb odors or liquids ensuring your tea is uncontaminated and as pure as possible
